<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GEOPOLITICS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/09/22/un-circus-comes-town?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The UN Circus Comes to Town
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="The UN Circus Comes to Town" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTY5MTcwNDczLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Tetra Images via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Manhattan readers: If you see more jacked people in sunglasses this week, it's because they're protecting the leaders of the world who are here for the United Nations General Assembly. There’ll be <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/09/22/world/americas/united-nations-what-to-expect.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">600 meetings</a> (none of which could have been emails) for the 193-member GA. We took a peek at a few leaders’ agendas...</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">German Chancellor Angela Merkel</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Climate change. Following “<a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-09-21/merkel-s-climate-deal-will-cost-billions-but-everyone-hates-it?srnd=premium&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tortuous all-night negotiations</a>” over Germany’s $60 billion climate plan, Merkel is struggling to find her place on the climate change A-team, writes Bloomberg. Some one-star reviews:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">From activists: </strong></span><span>insufficient for a “climate emergency.”</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">From economists:</strong></span><span> too gentle to force any changes from big business.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Today, Merkel joins ~60 heads of state at the UN’s Climate Action Summit. They’ve <a href="https://www.vox.com/2019/9/22/20877222/un-climate-action-summit-2019?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">been told</a> to leave the “beautiful speeches” at home and come instead with “concrete plans” for carbon neutrality by 2050.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">India’s Prime Minister Narendra Modi </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/09/21/business/economy/india-economy-trade.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Economic uncertainty</a>. After years of 8%-plus economic growth, India’s GDP is now growing closer to 5%. Unemployment is at 8.4% and rising.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Modi was in Houston yesterday at a rally with President Trump called “<a href="https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2019/09/modi-indian-pm-supporters-critics-gather-texas-190922000731038.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Howdy, Modi!</a>” that drew more than 50,000 people to the Texans’ NRG Stadium—hope you picked him up on waivers. Trump and Modi were expected to iron out trade differences and could reportedly sign a deal this week.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">As for other world leaders...</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Iranian President Hassan Rouhani</strong> will present a <a href="https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2019/09/iran-present-regional-security-plan-unga-rouhani-190922071055086.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">regional security plan</a> for the Gulf, but <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-09-22/trump-says-no-intention-to-meet-rouhani-at-united-nations?srnd=premium&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">don’t expect</a> a handshake with Trump.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Brazilian leader Jair Bolsonaro</strong> will open the UNGA with a speech to “<a href="https://www.ft.com/content/885e646c-d622-11e9-8367-807ebd53ab77?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reaffirm the issue</a>” of Brazil’s sovereignty after criticism of Bolsonaro’s handling of the Amazon rainforest fires.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">U.S. President Trump</strong> will put his dealmaking chops to the test. Some tensions that could use a little de-escalating this week, <a href="https://www.axios.com/un-general-assembly-trump-global-crises-c14cc6b0-06b8-477b-9b7e-fbb35b83dd63.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">per Axios</a>: Iran, North Korea, China, and the Taliban.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">And then there are the leaders playing hooky from the UN: </strong>China’s Xi Jinping, Russia’s Vladimir Putin, Israel’s Benjamin Netanyahu, and Venezuela’s Nicolás Maduro.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AUTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/09/22/gm-uaw-electrification-complicates-matters?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
No Easy Answers for GM and the UAW
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The United Auto Workers’ strike against GM is now in its eighth day. On “Solidarity Sunday” yesterday, Democratic presidential candidates including Sen. Elizabeth Warren and Joe Biden <a href="https://www.detroitnews.com/story/business/autos/general-motors/2019/09/22/gm-uaw-strike-day-7-solidarity-sunday-elizabeth-warren/2410052001/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">joined</a> a few of the nearly 50,000 workers on picket lines across the Midwest.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What does the union want? </strong>Higher wages, job guarantees, the preservation of a health insurance plan, and more profit-sharing.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Strikers know a storm is coming</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">GM CEO Mary Barra thinks the <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/features/2019-09-19/before-gm-goes-electric-mary-barra-has-a-strike-to-settle?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">future of transportation</a> looks something like you playing video games riding in a self-driving electric car. But the company’s production system wasn’t set up for that. As the AP <a href="https://apnews.com/c70d4274a69643bba37667585dbee7aa?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">notes</a>, mixing chemicals to make electric car batteries requires fewer humans than labor-intensive engine and transmission plants. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If Barra wants to execute her plan of selling 1 million electric cars per year in the near future, she’ll need to upend GM’s manufacturing landscape, starting with the five North American factory closures announced last year. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>GM’s push into the great unknown of electric cars is complicating already complicated labor negotiations.</p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CRYPTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/09/22/nyse-owner-launches-bitcoin-futures?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Bitcoin on the Big Stage
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Bitcoin on the Big Stage" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTY5MTcxMjMwLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Unsplash</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What the owner of the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) says:</strong> We launched a market for bitcoin futures.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What the owner of the NYSE means:</strong> We think institutional investors will finally catch the crypto drift now that we’ve given it some legitimacy.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Last night, NYSE owner Intercontinental Exchange (ICE) <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/nyse-owner-to-launch-long-awaited-bitcoin-futures-11569153649?mod=lead_feature_below_a_pos1&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">launched bitcoin futures</a>, allowing traders to bet on whether the underlying bitcoin market will rise or fall. The new contracts come via Bakkt, a venture that aims to make cryptocurrencies more transparent and regulated...and subsequently more commonplace in the economy.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Because there’s a reason you didn’t pay for your PSL with bitcoin this morning, and that reason is likely volatility. ICE’s futures will try to make <a href="https://fortune.com/2019/09/20/bitcoin-futures-bakkt-launch/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">protecting yourself</a> from crypto’s characteristic price swings (+171% this year) easier.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">As for competition...</strong>ICE rival CME Group launched bitcoin futures in December 2017 at the height of crypto mania. The main difference between the two: ICE will pay traders who hold futures to expiration in bitcoin or deliver bitcoin to Bakkt to settle bets; CME’s bitcoin futures are settled in dollars.</p>

SPORTS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/09/22/rugby-world-cup-beer-balls-business?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Please Don't Hurt Us
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<img alt="Please Don't Hurt Us" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTY5MTYwMDA0LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Craig Mercer/MB Media/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Rugby World Cup <a href="https://www.rugbyworldcup.com/matches?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">kicked off</a> in Japan this weekend, and our bodies are sore just looking at that photo. (That is, of course, the defending champs New Zealand All Blacks performing the Haka before their match vs. South Africa on Saturday). </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As always with massive sporting events, there are interesting business storylines...</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Beer: </strong>Rugby fans drink a lot. How much is a lot? Well, Heineken’s Japanese brewery <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/sport/2019/sep/13/beer-ball-10-rugby-world-cup-rugby-union-japan-2019?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">boosted production</a> by 80% to accommodate demand. Organizers have also given info sessions to restaurants and bars on how to deal with the crowds and fans who take off their clothes. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Technology: </strong>Journalists will be able to enter some stadiums just by showing their faces. Japan is hoping to use facial recognition technology for all accredited workers at next year’s Olympics in Tokyo. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Tourism: </strong>Speaking of the Tokyo Olympics, Japan is ramping up tourism ahead of its hosting duties. The country wants to draw <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-09-17/rugby-world-cup-2019-japan-stockpiling-beer-for-foreign-tourists?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">40 million annual visitors</a> by 2020. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The World Cup ball: </strong>It’s named Sirius, after the seventh-closest star to Earth.</p>

CALENDAR
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/09/22/week-ahead-un-general-assembly-fall-tv?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Along with the first day of fall, today is also the start of the (antiquated?) 2019–2020 TV season. ABC, CBS, Fox, and NBC are rolling out roughly 60 new and returning prime-time shows this week, <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/emmys-kick-off-a-big-week-in-tv-11569157204?mod=hp_lead_pos8&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">per the WSJ</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Monday: </strong>UN Climate Action Summit in NYC</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Tuesday: </strong>Consumer confidence; earnings (Nike, Manchester United, BlackBerry); National Voter Registration Day </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Wednesday: </strong>New home sales; happy 90th b-day Barbara Walters </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Thursday: </strong>GDP data; corporate profits; international trade numbers; earnings (Micron Technology, Vail Resorts, ConAgra Brands, Rite Aid, Accenture) </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Friday: </strong>Personal income and outlays inflation data; durable goods orders; World Tourism Day</p>

width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTY5MTcwNDczLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eTetra Images via Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eManhattan readers: If you see more jacked people in sunglasses this week, it's because they're protecting the leaders of the world who are here for the United Nations General Assembly. There’ll be \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/09/22/world/americas/united-nations-what-to-expect.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e600 meetings\u003c/a\u003e (none of which could have been emails) for the 193-member GA. We took a peek at a few leaders’ agendas...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eGerman Chancellor Angela Merkel\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eClimate change. Following “\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-09-21/merkel-s-climate-deal-will-cost-billions-but-everyone-hates-it?srnd=premium\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etortuous all-night negotiations\u003c/a\u003e” over Germany’s $60 billion climate plan, Merkel is struggling to find her place on the climate change A-team, writes Bloomberg. Some one-star reviews:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFrom activists: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003einsufficient for a “climate emergency.”\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFrom economists:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e too gentle to force any changes from big business.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eToday, Merkel joins ~60 heads of state at the UN’s Climate Action Summit. They’ve \u003ca href=\"https://www.vox.com/2019/9/22/20877222/un-climate-action-summit-2019?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebeen told\u003c/a\u003e to leave the “beautiful speeches” at home and come instead with “concrete plans” for carbon neutrality by 2050.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eIndia’s Prime Minister Narendra Modi \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/09/21/business/economy/india-economy-trade.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eEconomic uncertainty\u003c/a\u003e. After years of 8%-plus economic growth, India’s GDP is now growing closer to 5%. Unemployment is at 8.4% and rising.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eModi was in Houston yesterday at a rally with President Trump called “\u003ca href=\"https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2019/09/modi-indian-pm-supporters-critics-gather-texas-190922000731038.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eHowdy, Modi!\u003c/a\u003e” that drew more than 50,000 people to the Texans’ NRG Stadium—hope you picked him up on waivers. Trump and Modi were expected to iron out trade differences and could reportedly sign a deal this week.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eAs for other world leaders...\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIranian President Hassan Rouhani\u003c/strong\u003e will present a \u003ca href=\"https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2019/09/iran-present-regional-security-plan-unga-rouhani-190922071055086.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eregional security plan\u003c/a\u003e for the Gulf, but \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-09-22/trump-says-no-intention-to-meet-rouhani-at-united-nations?srnd=premium\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edon’t expect\u003c/a\u003e a handshake with Trump.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBrazilian leader Jair Bolsonaro\u003c/strong\u003e will open the UNGA with a speech to “\u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/885e646c-d622-11e9-8367-807ebd53ab77?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereaffirm the issue\u003c/a\u003e” of Brazil’s sovereignty after criticism of Bolsonaro’s handling of the Amazon rainforest fires.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eU.S. President Trump\u003c/strong\u003e will put his dealmaking chops to the test. Some tensions that could use a little de-escalating this week, \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/un-general-assembly-trump-global-crises-c14cc6b0-06b8-477b-9b7e-fbb35b83dd63.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eper Axios\u003c/a\u003e: Iran, North Korea, China, and the Taliban.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAnd then there are the leaders playing hooky from the UN: \u003c/strong\u003eChina’s Xi Jinping, But the company’s production system wasn’t set up for that. As the AP \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/c70d4274a69643bba37667585dbee7aa?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enotes\u003c/a\u003e, mixing chemicals to make electric car batteries requires fewer humans than labor-intensive engine and transmission plants. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf Barra wants to execute her plan of selling 1 million electric cars per year in the near future, style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat the owner of the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) says:\u003c/strong\u003e We launched a style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLast night, NYSE owner Intercontinental Exchange (ICE) \u003ca The new contracts come via Bakkt, a venture that aims to make cryptocurrencies more transparent and regulated...and subsequently more commonplace in the economy.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBecause there’s a reason you didn’t pay for your PSL with bitcoin this morning, and that reason is likely volatility. (That is, of course, the defending champs New Zealand All Blacks performing the Haka before their match vs. South Africa on Saturday). \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAs always with massive sporting events, there are interesting business storylines...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBeer: \u003c/strong\u003eRugby fans drink a lot. Well, Heineken’s Japanese brewery \u003ca href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/sport/2019/sep/13/beer-ball-10-rugby-world-cup-rugby-union-japan-2019?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eboosted production\u003c/a\u003e by 80% to accommodate demand. Organizers have also given info sessions to restaurants and bars on how to deal with the crowds and fans who take off their clothes. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTechnology: \u003c/strong\u003eJournalists will be able to enter some stadiums just by showing their faces. Japan is hoping to use facial recognition technology for all accredited workers at next year’s Olympics in Tokyo. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTourism: \u003c/strong\u003eSpeaking of the Tokyo Olympics, Japan is ramping up tourism ahead of its hosting duties. The country wants to draw \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-09-17/rugby-world-cup-2019-japan-stockpiling-beer-for-foreign-tourists?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e40 million annual visitors\u003c/a\u003e by 2020. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe World Cup ball: \u003c/strong\u003eIt’s named Sirius, after the seventh-closest star to
